page.title: 08A75 EURO-ROUTE NEAR SHAWHEAD
page.content:
The A75 goes through our block. It is called the Euro-route. It is a small part of the route from Ireland to Europe and runs from Stranraer to Gretna.
The traffic is mainly lorries and holiday traffic going across to Ireland by ferry. It is very noisy and at times can be heard from the village, especially at night. Traffic passes school to get to the A75.
There are many accidents on the road. Some are caused by foreign drivers driving on the wrong side of the road. The road goes through many villages and small towns where the speed limit is reduced to 30 or 40mph. Not many drivers stick to these speed limits.
